items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.
items.item_text: Information on Public Comments and Disability Access
items.item_text_raw: 2. Information on Public Comments and Disability Access

items.item_details:
By law, the Board of Trustees is required to place a notice in the local newspaper that the District will be presenting a budget to the Board for adoption at its September 28 meeting, and that the public may comment on the budget.  Notice was posted in the San Jose Mercury News on Saturday, September 4, 2010, and the budget was made available to the public for inspection Tuesday, September 21, 2010. 
 
This item is intended to identify the place in the agenda where the public may comment on the proposed adopted budget.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are:   short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details: The funds provided through this project will be utilized to provide support services to improve student retention, program completion, and success on the National Council Licensure Exam (NCLEX).  The term of the grant is July 1, 2010 to June 30, 2012.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept grant funds in the amount of $293,374 awarded to Evergreen Valley College's Nursing program from the State Chancellor's Office, Nursing Education Program, Enrollment Growth and Retention for Registered Nursing Program.

items.item_details:
The course outlined in this board item is being proposed for Board of Trustee approval.
	 
The proposed course has been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and approved by the All-College Curriculum Committee, acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate. The rigor of the approval process assures that each new course has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and that it fills a clear student need not being served by existing course offerings.
	 
Course and Title:      ETH-020: African American Culture                                3.0  Units
Lecture Hours:   3.0
Lab Hours:         0
Advisory Basic Skills:  Read and Write Level 3
Prerequisite:   None
Corequisite:    None
Recommended Preparation:  None
Course Description:  This course is a survey of the African American experience in the United States.  Students will crirtically examine past, present and evolving, social, political and economic cultural dynamics that create African American culture.
Credit Status:  AA/AS Applicable

Lab Hours: 0.0

Corequisite: None
Recommended Preparation: None
Course Description: This course is a survey of the African American experience in the United States. Students will critically examine past, present and evolving social, political, and economic dynamics that create African American culture
Credit Status: AA/AS Applicable

items.item_details: Oral reports will be given by members of the Board of Trustees.
Oral reports will be given by Chancellor Rita Cepeda.
Oral reports will be given by the college presidents.
Oral reports will be given by the constituency representatives.

ADOPTION OF THE FY2010-2011 BUDGET
 
The San Jose Evergreen Community College District Proposed Adopted Budget for fiscal year 2010-2011 is comprised of the following funds (the detail of which can be found in the accompanying 2010-2011 Adopted Budget Document):
 
General Fund
 
	 
01-General Fund Unrestricted
$78,006,483 
17-General Fund Restricted
19,345,252
 
 
Total General Fund
$97,351,735 
 
 
 
 
Other Funds
 
11-Parking - Restricted
$779,030
12-Apprenticeship - Restricted
17,362
15-Facility Rental
95,000
16-Workforce Institute
1,881,597
18-Health - Restricted
647,956
31-GO Bond – Measure G Series B- Restricted
81,629,778
36-Capital Projects - Restricted
 1,067,369
48-Student Financial Aid - Restricted
21,570,276
61-Self Insurance - Restricted
1,533,600
70-Cafeteria
121,706
72-Child Development - Restricted
732,110
75 OPEB Trust - Restricted
3,514,300
81-L/T Debt Retiree Benefits - Restricted
3,357,120
83-L/T Debt GO Bond-Measure I - Restricted
1,249,200
84-L/T Debt GO Bond-Measure G-2004 - Restricted
5,322,759
85-L/T Debt OPEB Income - Restricted
2,191,019
 
 
Total Other 
$135,710,452 
 
 
TOTAL PROPOSED ADOPTED BUDGET
$233,062,187
	 
	 
The FY2010-2011 Proposed Adopted Budget reflects the best information currently available. 
	 
It is important to note that as of this writing the state has yet to pass a FY2010-2011 state budget. The District has not included pending budget items from legislative negotiations, so any revisions that are necessary as the result of budget passage will be included as first quarter revisions.
 
The District Budget Committee has actively reviewed this budget and its members have provided transparent and strategic direction throughout the budget development process during which all constituencies had input.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt the FY2010-2011 budget as presented in the accompanying budget document detailing the various funds of the District.

items.item_details:
The San Jose City College men's basketball team has been selected to participate in the Dallas Blowout Jamboree October 6-10 in Dallas, Texas.  This is a national event that SJCC will be competing in with 60 college teams nationwide.  San Jose City College is the only college from California that will be participating in this event.  There will be representatives from over three hundred 4-year colleges at this event which will give great exposure to San Jose City College and our student-athletes.  We appreciate your support of our student-athletes and their participation in this event.
	 
Budget Detail: Total cost includes flight, hotel, food, and ground transportation and is estimated for the amount of $11,357.  Half of the cost will be funded by the SJCC Men's Basketball Foundation account through fundraising activities.  The other half will be funded by the College.  The chaperones will be Percy Carr, Lawrence Crawford, and Solomon Wilson.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the SJCC Men's Basketball team travel to Texas for the Texas Blowout Jamboree.
items.item_text: SJCC Basketball Out of State Travel
items.item_text_raw: 2. SJCC Basketball Out of State Travel

items.item_details:
Proposition 24 on the Nov 2nd California Ballot repeals recent legislation that would allow businesses to lower their tax liability.  The fiscal impact of this proposition would result in increased state revenues of about $1.3 billion each year by 2012–13 from higher taxes paid by some businesses. Smaller increases in 2010–11 and 2011–12.
	 
Proposition 25 Changes legislative vote requirement to pass budget and budget-related legislation from two-thirds to a simple majority.  It retains two-thirds vote requirement for taxes.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt resolutions in support of Propositions 24 and 25.

items.item_details: Proposition 26 on the November 2nd California ballot requires that certain state and local fees be approved by two-thirds vote.  Fees include those that address adverse impacts on society or the environment caused by the fee-payer's business.  Fiscal impact:  depending on decisions by governing bodies and voters, decreased state and local government revenues and spending (up to billions of dollars annually).  Increased transportion spending and state General Fund costs ($1 billion annually.)
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt a resolution in opposition of Proposition 26.

items.item_details: Chancellor Cepeda and Vice Chancellor Hawk will provide a budget update.
Chancellor Cepeda will provide a Legislative Update.

The Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges – Western Association of Schools and Colleges, will be conducting a site review at Evergreen Valley College October 18-21, 2010.  The last comprehensive review was conducted in 2004.  The purpose of the site review is to validate the college’s Application for Reaffirmation of Accreditation that was submitted to the Commission in July 2010.  
	 
This report will highlight the college’s preparation for the site review and progress made toward meeting the accreditation standards.

The Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges-Western Association of Schools and Colleges, will be conducting a site review at San Jose City College October 18-21, 2010.  The last comprehensive review was conducted in 2004.  The purpose of the site review is to validate the college's Application for Reaffirmation of Accreditation that was submitted to the Commission in August 2010.
	 
This report will highlight the college's preparation for the site review and progress made toward meeting the accreditation standards.
	 
	 
	 
http://jaguar.sjcc.edu/accreditation/SJCC%20Accreditation%20Self%20Study_2010.pdf
